title: BODYGUARD

description.plain:
“BODYGUARD” is a powerful anthem of protection and devotion. The lyrics convey a message of being a steadfast supporter and defender in a relationship, offering a sense of security and loyalty to her partner. The song’s narrative suggests a dynamic where the protagonist is willing to go to great lengths to ensure the safety and happiness of their loved one, even in the face of adversity or external judgment.

The imagery used in the song, such as “kisses in the backseat”, “lipstick on the cigarette” and “inhalin' whiskey” paints a picture of intimate moments shared between two people. These moments are contrasted with the struggles they face, indicated by phrases like “we’ve been hurting”, but the overall tone remains one of overcoming challenges together. The references to being a ‘bodyguard,’ ‘Kevlar,’ and ‘lifeguard’ are metaphors for the protective role the singer is willing to play, emphasizing the theme of unwavering support.

The production marks a bit of a departure from the previous songs on the album up to this point, combining elements of surf rock with some ‘90s country revival goodness resulting in a cruising, chill groove. This is reinforces her statement that COWBOY CARTER “ain’t a Country album…[it’s] a “Beyoncé” album.”.

In a 2025 interview with the Los Angeles Times, Raphael Saadiq talked about the creation of “Bodyguard”:

It wasn’t originally for Beyoncé — it was for me. I put this groove together, kind of a Memphis slash Fleetwood Mac slash “Pretty Woman,” Roy Orbison type of vibe. I had it in my folder, and I was playing stuff for Beyoncé. […] So I played a little bit of it on accident, and she’s like, “Go back, go back — what are you doing with that?” I honestly couldn’t believe she picked it. I just didn’t see it. Then when she sang it, she did some stuff vocally that completely matched the era of what I was doing but that I would never have done. She took it and made it her own thing.

embed_content: Read “BODYGUARD” by Beyoncé on Genius
recording_location: Westlake Recording Studios (Los Angeles, CA) and The Sound Factory (Hollywood, CA)

body.plain:
“BODYGUARD” is a powerful anthem of protection and devotion. The lyrics convey a message of being a steadfast supporter and defender in a relationship, offering a sense of security and loyalty to her partner. The song’s narrative suggests a dynamic where the protagonist is willing to go to great lengths to ensure the safety and happiness of their loved one, even in the face of adversity or external judgment.

The imagery used in the song, such as “kisses in the backseat”, “lipstick on the cigarette” and “inhalin' whiskey” paints a picture of intimate moments shared between two people. These moments are contrasted with the struggles they face, indicated by phrases like “we’ve been hurting”, but the overall tone remains one of overcoming challenges together. The references to being a ‘bodyguard,’ ‘Kevlar,’ and ‘lifeguard’ are metaphors for the protective role the singer is willing to play, emphasizing the theme of unwavering support.

The production marks a bit of a departure from the previous songs on the album up to this point, combining elements of surf rock with some ‘90s country revival goodness resulting in a cruising, chill groove. This is reinforces her statement that COWBOY CARTER “ain’t a Country album…[it’s] a “Beyoncé” album.”.

In a 2025 interview with the Los Angeles Times, Raphael Saadiq talked about the creation of “Bodyguard”:

It wasn’t originally for Beyoncé — it was for me. I put this groove together, kind of a Memphis slash Fleetwood Mac slash “Pretty Woman,” Roy Orbison type of vibe. I had it in my folder, and I was playing stuff for Beyoncé. […] So I played a little bit of it on accident, and she’s like, “Go back, go back — what are you doing with that?” I honestly couldn’t believe she picked it. I just didn’t see it. Then when she sang it, she did some stuff vocally that completely matched the era of what I was doing but that I would never have done. She took it and made it her own thing.

Inhalin' whiskey when you kiss my neck
We've been hurtin', but it's happy hour, oh, hour
Oh, oh, oh

They couldn't have me (Ah)
And they never will
And sometimes I hold you closer
Just to know you're real (Ah)
Wheels in the gravel
Davis in my bones
Sometimes I take the day off (Ah)
Just to turn you on
On, on, oh

Oh, honey, honey

Be your best friend
I protect you in the mosh pit
And I'll defend you in the gossip
You know how people like to start shit and pop shit
I don't like the way she's lookin' at you
Someone better hold me back, oh-oh
Chargin' ten for a double and I'm talkin'

And they never will (You see)
Sometimes I hold you closer
Just to know you're real (Ah)
Tell me your problems (I got you)
I take how you feel (Mm, huh)
I show you an exit (Ah)
When you're restless, I take the wheel
Ooh, oh, oh

Oh, honey, honey
Will you let me ride shotgun? Shotgun
Oh, oh, oh
